main event: A bright, round, fast-moving object was observed at a high altitude and speed on June 4, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a star, observed at an altitude of 80-90 degrees., It moved at an estimated speed of 600 mph in a straight, horizontal path for a distance of 30 degrees., The observation lasted about 1.5 hours and was conducted through a telescope., The object displayed a distinctive shape and luminous characteristics, suggesting controlled flight., The observer was experienced in meteorological and astronomical phenomena.
witness description: a competent observer experienced in meteorological phenomena and astronomical objects
